intro: Aulacospermum alaicum, commonly known as the alaicum, is a flowering plant native to the southern regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in dry, sunny environments and is often found in rocky or arid soils. The plant's unique morphology and habitat make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
